name: Permitted Point-source Discharges
functionStatement: Quantity and quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) do not generate harmful peaks or pollution pulses and instead support diverse habitat conditions and native species.
descriptionMarkdown: Presence of permitted point-source discharges upstream (municipal/industrial) that may affect flow and/or water quality.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Desktop (permit/layer review) with field verification where feasible
howToMeasureMarkdown: Query NPDES (or state-equivalent) permit records for facilities in the watershed and within the specified distance upstream. Summarize count and (if required) relative discharge magnitude (e.g., as a percent of baseflow). Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Permitted Point-source Discharges
inputs.type: desktop (permit/layer review) with field verification where feasible
inputs.helpMarkdown:
EPA ECHO/NPDES facility data and state permit databases; optional local outfall GIS layers.
ADEC database

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: No CDPS permitted facilities upstream of the project reach. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: CDPS permitted facilities comprise a low to moderate percentage of the baseflow in the project reach AND no facilities are located within 2 miles upstream of project reach. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: CDPS permitted facilities comprise a low to moderate percentage of the baseflow in the project reach AND no facilities are located within 2 miles upstream of project reach. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: CDPS permitted facilities comprise a high percentage of the baseflow in the project reach OR 1 or more facilities present within 2 miles upstream of project reach have a high potential to threaten aquatic life. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)
